page.title: 01INTRODUCTION - BARNSLEY
page.content: The area we are concerned with is mainly farmland owned by several large landowners. The main one is Lord Faringdon, a stockbroker, whose company, Barnsley Estates, owns a lot of the village. One of the farms in the village, Church Farm, is owned by Mr Russell and is also very large. The village of Barnsley is the main centre of population - it has 121 people. It lies on the A433, a busy main road between Cirencester and Burford. The road follows the course of the old Roman road, Akeman Street. The road which skirts the area, the A429, is called the Fosse Way and is also a Roman road. Between the two is an old sheep road called Welsh Way used to drive sheep from Wales to the markets. There are no shops in Barnsley at all and no Post Office either. There is one pub and a village hall.
